Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2009 11:05AM momto3 wrote: Thanks Just -Sher, My cancer was also found on my mammogram--no lump.  Now have a benign intraductal papilloma on left side that needs to be removed.  My genetic testing came back negative as well.  I have had 2 aunts and my mom have successful lumpectomies and radiation. So far no one is brca pos, but I am sure there must be some yet to be disovered gene lurking in the shadows.  I will probably make my decision this week. Anyone else have issues with their spouse being afraid of mastectomy?/
Posts.Title: Dx'd with DCIS /mastectomy, now have microinvasion Just-Sher momto3

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2009 11:20PM - edited Dec 18, 2009 11:20PM by momto3 i am 44 and also perimenopausal and have mostly dcis and about a 2mm invasion.  have not had surgery yet but curious as to why you chose a bilateral mx over a lumpectomy with radiation?
Posts.Title: Dx'd with DCIS /mastectomy, now have microinvasion Just-Sher momto3

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2010 03:35AM momto3 wrote: Thanks for all of your help. I had lumpectomy 3 weeks ago but they did not get clear margins- too much dcis. Seeing surgeon again to decide between mastectomy or another lumpectomy. My oncotype score just came back at 28 so they want to do chemo and start it before the next surgery.
Posts.Title: Anyone with successful Lumpectomy stories momto3 ootee

Posts.Content: momto3 wrote: No one in my family who has had breast cancer has gone down the mastecomy road. They have had lumpectomies and radiation and chemo(below 50 and over 50).  Anyone else out there with successful lumpectomies??  Lots of encouraging stories with mastecomies and reconstruction--just wondering about the alternative lumpectomy scenario.  Dx 11/23/2009, DCIS, 6cm+, Stage I, 0/5 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone with successful Lumpectomy stories momto3 ootee
